alert.note: Alert for Barry; McDonald; Newton (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 24 at 1:35AM CDT until March 24 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Barry County in southwestern Missouri... McDonald County in southwestern Missouri... Southeastern Newton County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 500 AM CDT. * At 135 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Neosho, Monett, Pineville, Granby, Anderson, Noel, Goodman, Purdy, South West City, Powell, Rocky Comfort, Pleasant Ridge and Big Sugar Creek State Park. This includes the following low water crossings... Butler Creek at Kings Highway, Little Sugar Creek at Skaggs Hollow Road, North Indian Creek at Orchid Drive, Hickory Creek at Coler RD, Elkhorn Creek at Highway CC, Buffalo Creek at Klondike Road and Shoal Creek at Farm Road 2110. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
